list.title: Collision.simpleBoxesOverlap
list.description: Simple case of checking two boxes without rotation applied for overlap.

list.title: Events
list.description: Sets Events.instance to the created instance.

list.title: Events#dispatch
list.description: Dispatch an event.

list.title: FixedResolutionGrid#getAtPoint
list.description: Get all hits at a point, using the provided pointCollisionTest.

list.title: FixedResolutionGrid#getCollisions
list.description: Get all elements the given element is colliding with, using the provided elementsCollisionTest.

list.title: FixedResolutionGrid#update
list.description: Updates object's coordinates in the grid. Call before changing the object's position.

list.title: HashTable#toString
list.description: String representation of the table.

list.title: Loop#isPaused
list.description: May manipulate directly to manage pause state

list.title: Loop#pushToActionQueue
list.description: Append one or more default actions that will run each frame. Currently the only way to remove specific actions is to have them named and set them to falsey values, the system will remove them from the queue.

list.title: Loop#start
list.description: Start or restart the loop. There can be only one active loop so any other active one will be replaced. Expected to be called only once, or whenever switching to different active Loop instance. For pause management you may simply use isPaused property.

list.title: Loop.active
list.description: Currently active Loop instance, set automatically when start method is called

list.title: Loop~FrameAction
list.description: A procedure that the Loop class can run each frame.

list.title: Noise
list.description:
Perlin noise by Stefan Gustavson

Example use:

Noise.seed(Math.random());
for (var x = 0; x < 100; x++)
  for (var y = 0; y < 100; y++)
    something[x][y] = Noise.simplex2(x /100, y / 100);

list.title: Noise.simplex2
list.description: 2D simplex noise

list.title: Queue#dequeue
list.description: Get the next item and remove it from the queue

list.title: Sprite#getBoundingBox
list.description: Get bounding box with scaling applied. Override for non-standard bounding box sizes.

list.title: Sprite#update
list.description: Must be called after making any changes on the sprite to re-render it.

list.title: Sprite.addToContainer
list.description: Must be called to make sprite visible. Currently there can be only one container per sprite.

list.title: Sprite.idMap
list.description: Populated with sprites mapped by ID

list.title: Sprite.removeFromContainer
list.description: Immediately removes the sprite from the containing DOM Element.

list.title: SpriteDefinition.table
list.description: Populated with sprite definitions mapped by ID

list.title: Sprite~Transform
list.description: Representation of sprite's location, size, and rotation. Changes to this object will be visible only after call to the sprite's update().

list.title: StoryWindow#loadTree
list.description: Use for branching narrative. Creates a table of segment labels and immediately starts writing.

list.title: StoryWindow#popIn
list.description: Make story window visible, using procedure defined in popInCallback. The method will also first mark the window visible and set it as active.

list.title: StoryWindow#popOut
list.description: Close story window, using procedure defined in popOutCallback. The method will also first mark the window no longer visible.

list.title: StoryWindow#skip
list.description: Wrapper for typewriter.skip().

list.title: StoryWindow#update
list.description: Must be called each frame.

list.title: StoryWindow#write
list.description: Set this window to be active one and start typing given text.

list.title: StoryWindow#writeNextSegment
list.description: Starts typing next segment of a sequence, will be called if dispatching storyWindowSkipRequested.

list.title: StoryWindow#writeSequence
list.description: Start writing multi-segment story sequence. Will suffice when branching narrative is not required, otherwise use loadTree.

list.title: StoryWindow~StorySegment
list.description: Optional object that may be sent to a sequence instead of a string.

list.title: TimedSequence#start
list.description: Must be called to start the sequence.

list.title: TimedSequence#update
list.description: Must be called each frame.

list.title: TimedSequence~SequenceSegmentAction
list.description: Callback called at start of a segment.

list.title: TimedSequence~TimedSequenceSegment
list.description: A segment of a sequence that can be managed by the TimedSequence.

list.title: Typewriter#delay
list.description: Delay in seconds before next character is written

list.title: Typewriter#running
list.description: Can be safely used to pause and unpause the typewriter

list.title: Typewriter#skip
list.description: Skips the animation and shows full text.

list.title: Typewriter#textElem
list.description: DOM element that contains text

list.title: Vector2#normalize
list.description: Normalize vector.

list.title: Vector2.Right
list.description: Static instance of +x vector

list.title: Vector2.Up
list.description: Static instance of +y vector

list.title: Vector2.Zero
list.description: Static instance of vector with magnitude zero

list.title: Vector2.norm
list.description: Returns a new instance that is the given vector normalized.
